channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI taking your job? That’s just what these CEOs want you to believe.
item.description: Companies spend billions on AI infrastructure they never fully use — then cut workers to cover up their mess.

item.title: FIRE fans carefully planned their early retirement. Then health-insurance costs exploded.
item.description: With pandemic-era subsidies for Obamacare set to end in 2026, people in the FIRE community are adjusting their plans to account for bigger health-insu...

item.title: Jobless claims sink to 3-year low in no-hire, no-fire U.S. economy
item.description: The number of people who applied for unemployment benefits around the Thanksgiving holiday fell to a more than three-year low, reinforcing the view th...

item.title: ‘We fear people will end up in financial trouble.’ Americans will spend a record $20 billion via buy-now-pay-later during the holidays.
item.description: Record spending on Black Friday and Cyber Monday was partly due to historic use of buy-now-pay-later options.

item.title: ‘I don’t have money to pay for a death certificate’: My sister refuses to probate my father’s estate. What can I do?
item.description: “I recently received paperwork from a company that my father had invested in.”

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
